summary: Lake Baikal is an incredibly deep lake in Siberia, Russia. It's the largest freshwater lake by volume, holding about 23,615 cubic kilometers of water! This ancient lake is around 25-30 million years old and is home to many unique plants and animals. The lake is so big that it's even larger than the country of Belgium. The water is very clear, and the surrounding area is home to the Buryat people and their livestock. UNESCO recognized its importance and made it a World Heritage Site.
title: Lake Baikal
